description.narrative: Kvinna till Kvinna har lämnat in en ansökan till Sida om finansiering på 51 437 307 miljoner kronor för att genomföra programmet Enhancing Women's Rights and Empowerment i Liberia, under perioden september 2016 - december 2020. Insatsen är en fortsättning på Kvinna till Kvinnas (KtK) långsiktiga arbete i att stödja lokala liberianska kvinnorättsorganisationer att stärka den liberianska kvinnorörelsen och på så sätt öka jämställdheten och kvinnors röster i landet. Kvinna till Kvinna arbetar med kapacitetsutveckling av partnerorganisationer och beviljar medel till partnerorganisationer för att genomföra aktiviteter som stärker kvinnor och främjar kvinnors rättigheter. Kvinna till Kvinnas fokus under de följande åren kommer att ligga på kvinnors deltagande i beslutsfattande och fredsbyggande, förebyggande av könsrelaterat våld, kvinnors ekonomiska egenmakt (från år 2) och ett ökat institutionellt nätverkande, samhällsinflytande och tematisk kapacitet av kvinnorättsorganisationer.

Kvinna till Kvinna has submitted an application to Sida for funding of 51 437 307 million SEK to carry out the programme, Enhancing Women's Rights and Empowerment in Liberia, during the period September 2016 - December 2020. The intervention is a continuation of Kvinna till Kvinna’s (KtK) long term work, supporting local Liberian women organizations to strengthen the Liberian women’s right movement and by so doing enhance gender equality and women’s voices in the country. Kvinna till Kvinna works with capacity development of partner organizations and sub grants funds to partner organizations to implement activities that empower women and promote women’s rights. Kvinna till Kvinna focus during the ensuing years will be on women’s participation in decision making and peace building, prevention of gender-based violence, women´s economic empowerment (from year 2) and increased institutional networking, advocacy and thematic capacity of women’s rights organizations.

The intended outcome of the programme is a stronger and more connected women rights movement in Liberia working more effectively for womens rights and empowerment including the opportunity and capacity to participate qualitatively in decision-making on different levels, act against gender-based violence and strengthen their economic empowerment.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 10.6 - Ensure enhanced representation and voice for developing countries in decision-making in global international economic and financial institutions in order to deliver more effective, credible, accountable and legitimate institutions.

10.6 - Säkra stärkt representation och röst till utvecklingsländer i beslutsfattandet i globala internationella ekonomiska och finansiella institutioner i syfte att göra dessa mer effektiva, trovärdiga, ansvarsskyldiga och legitima.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: Under Outcome 1, partners have diversified their funding portfolios, developed their program management skills and have achieved important milestones in strengthening their capacities. Eight of the nine partners have an up-to-date strategic plan in place and have managed to attract sources of funding other than KtK. All the partners have a staff policy, a written code of conduct, and an HR manual in place. Furthermore, in 2019, KtK facilitated an update of the Octagon self-assessment tool, developed by Sida in which 7 of the nine partners assessed their capacities as improved. The partners themselves show diverse and innovative approaches to achieving results across the three programmatic outcomes and are active in Montserrado, Grand Bassa, Bong, Nimba, River Gee, Maryland, Grand Kru, and Sinoe. Under Outcome 2, at the local level, there is evidence that women and girls have increased their knowledge and capacity in decision-making and peacebuilding. This has been achieved through a diverse array of approaches by partner organizations. To give a few examples, Rural Women Rights Structure combined participation and economic empowerment capacity targeting women and girls and achieved an increase in women's participation in community meetings from 40% to 75% in 2019. LIWEN created women and girls’ forums that led to 7 women and girls seeking and achieving leadership positions that include, among others, community chairperson, township commissioner and advisor to Zonal Chief. Under Outcome 3, partners have both increased and diversified the types of prevention and response services they provide. All partners engaged in this outcome have successfully engaged men and boys. WORIWA conducted awareness raising around GBV that focused on youth through sports competitions. These involved 102 boys, 99 girls and over 1500 spectators. WONGOSOL facilitated trainings with 121 community members, including community leadership members. West Point Women provided trainings on the Maputo Protocol and the Rape law to communities in West point and Slipway and provided support and training to the Community Male Action Group. In total, over 7000 people in 2019 participated in awareness raising activities or received messages on GBV. Outcome 4 has increased women's access to information on their rights to property, land and income, and enhanced livelihoods. Over 1300 women have benefited from economic empowerment initiatives. In 2019, VSLA groups in Bong and Sinoe combined generated over USD 60,000 in savings, generating profits of USD 7,600.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
